title: How to Remove Mold from a Barbie Doll

steps.headline: Remove any form of clothing.
steps.description: This includes shoes, hair ties, "earrings" and anything else that can be removed from the barbie doll

steps.headline: Fill a sink with lukewarm or hot water.
steps.description: This will be where you will wash the doll out.

steps.headline: Mix baking soda with baby soap and a teaspoon of vinegar for a stronger cleaning mixture.
Apply the baby soap to the doll (or the cleaning combo from the last step) and scrub the doll with the used toothbrush making sure to work the mixture into the stains .
Wash the doll out and shake the doll to remove any water from in the doll's body.
steps.description: Set to dry in a warm sunny location or dry of with a wash rag.

text: Remove any form of clothing. This includes shoes, hair ties, "earrings" and anything else that can be removed from the barbie doll Fill a sink with lukewarm or hot water. This will be where you will wash the doll out. Mix baking soda with baby soap and a teaspoon of vinegar for a stronger cleaning mixture. This is optional. Apply the baby soap to the doll (or the cleaning combo from the last step) and scrub the doll with the used toothbrush making sure to work the mixture into the stains .  Wash the doll out and shake the doll to remove any water from in the doll's body. Set to dry in a warm sunny location or dry of with a wash rag. Dress your doll after cleaning.
sentences: This includes shoes, hair ties, "earrings" and anything else that can be removed from the barbie doll Fill a sink with lukewarm or hot water.
This will be where you will wash the doll out.
Mix baking soda with baby soap and a teaspoon of vinegar for a stronger cleaning mixture.
Apply the baby soap to the doll (or the cleaning combo from the last step) and scrub the doll with the used toothbrush making sure to work the mixture into the stains .
Wash the doll out and shake the doll to remove any water from in the doll's body.
Set to dry in a warm sunny location or dry of with a wash rag.
